name: Casa de Campo

reviews.text: Loved CAsa de Campo. It is expensive but worth the the money. Rooms were clean large and convienient. We were assigned a golf cart to get around. The area is beautiful. Top of the Line resort. Food was excellent. Service was excellent. Beaches were nice but man made so it is not the best beach but it does its job.
reviews.title: Awesome Stay

reviews.text: Marina is romantic good restaurants there. Alto de Chavon was beautiful. I would definately stay there again.
reviews.title: Stay away!

likes.liked: — The staff try to make an unworkable system work

reviews.title: Good Place to be in DR
reviews.text: Spent one week at Casa De Campo- I don't even know where to begin to describe this surreal experience. The bottom line is that nothing works the way it should at this overpriced US$ vacuum cleaner. One star for the staff who really try hard to make things work.

Particular kudos to Racio Alba at the concierge desk. The restaurants are mediocre and overpriced, the beach is tiny. The place is huge so you get a golf cart (gasoline, not electric so the whole place stinks of exhaust fumes) until your cart vanishes and you have to get a replacement (happened twice in 7 days). Think you have a cab reserved?
reviews.title: Golf Villa Vacation -- not for everyone but an elegant retreat

reviews.text: Think again. Double and triple check, because each time it's like starting over. We'll have to dispute a $250 fee for transportation services we never received with our credit card company. Basically, an
reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY MAGICAL

reviews.text: We didn't stay here, we visited the beach while on an outing to Altos De Chavon. The sands are near white and the beach is very clean, as well as the beautiful clear/ blue ocean. It's as pretty as Catalina Island without having to take a boat to get there. :-)
reviews.title: Beautiful beach and water!

reviews.text: This Resort is worth every dollar you spend. From the moment you arrive till checkout you feel pampered and special. The facilities have been updated since my last visit. The rooms are actions and tastefully furnished. All amenities are included even WiFi, which actually works everywhere. The pool area is wonderful, restaurant food is tasty and if your package includes the golf cart you will enjoying the entire 7000 acres of property. The included breakfast is very generous so you probably won't need to spend money on lunch. If you love beer then you have to try the great local beer, Presidente.
reviews.title: Beyond Excellent !

reviews.text: I want to go back. Very peaceful and perfect. It's huge though. That's why each room comes with a golf cart. The beach was a ten minute golf cart ride but it was a beautiful drive. This resort is a golf lovers paradise. It has four golf courses, one of which is private. The teeth of the dog course was not open yet when we were there but we took a walk there and it's right on the ocean and quite beautiful. The spa was thoroughly enjoyable. Go with the inclusive plan because you can easily spend $300 for two for dinner. Breakfast and lunch would be very expensive too. The pools are small but they were never even close to being crowded. There is a nice swim up bar at the pool. I did not make it to the riding stables but I heard other guests raving about it. Despite the fact that the resort was completely sold out, I never felt over crowded. In fact, most of the the time I wondered where everyone was. Take the time to go,to altos de Chavon. You could drive your cart but it's easy to get lost there even though you get a map. Ask the front desk to arrange transportation and they are very good about it. That's what we ended up doing. There is really only one restaurant open for breakfast but it was very good and not crowded at all. The pancake station was the best. All kinds of homemade marmalades for toppings. My personal favorite was the pineapple. Don't be afraid or scared off by the size of this place. We found that we could be at the bar and have fun dancing and yet the next night go to a very quiet place. There is a disco at Altos de Chavon that is open quite late. Fly into la romana. It's ten minutes from the resort. In fact, the resort owns the airport. Casa de campo can arrange for transportation ahead of time. I wish I could have spent a few more days here. Try the Ron punch....made with Ron rum...the only thing I did not like was that if you drink out of the stocked fridge you pay extra. Also if you want a beach front place, this isn't it but the short golf cart drive to the beach is not bad and the beach is beautiful. Restaurants at night are dressy and men need slacks and a nice shirt.
reviews.title: You gotta stay here. Put it on your bucket list.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So much more than world class golf, Casa de Campo was a great all inclusive getaway with my wife. Every morning we ate breakfast at the amazing buffet down by the golf staging area and then we drove the golf cart that came with our room all over the huge property. We even rode it up to Altos de Chavon, a 16th century Spanish Village recreated on the bluffs overlooking the Chavon River. In the afternoon, I played golf and my wife hung out by a pool, went to the beach or got a spa treatment. In the evening we dined at great restaurants at the marina or at Le Cirque right by the beach with wonderful breezes flowing. The atmosphere was very friendly. We always felt secure but not "cooped up" because the property is so big. Couldn't ask for more. PS "Teeth of the Dog" lived up to its rating as one of the great and demanding golf courses of the world with 7 holes right along the edge of the ocean.
reviews.title: Enchanting and Romantic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are looking for an upscale resort in the Dominican Republic, this is the place. It is probably known for its golf and I'm not a golfer but we spent a week here and just loved the property and restaurants.
reviews.title: Top Shelf Resort in the DR

reviews.text: La Romana: Casa de Campo, Dominican Republic
reviews.title: Ola'.......Casa de Campo

likes.liked: — Comfortable beds and great room in the main house.

reviews.title: A lot of good things but don't trust them...
reviews.text: We had the extreme pleasure of spending a week at Casa de Campo, May 3-10th as part of a group attending a conference there. The resort is

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2003, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: not measure up as 5 Star resort in my opinion...but that did not impact our stay in any way. We were aware of people making an effort to be friendly and accomodating.
reviews.title: First Prize One Week At Casa de Campo -Second: Two Weeks!

likes.liked: — Small beach, dated facilities, inaccurate billing, fake village, below average food

reviews.text: We were there just as off-season began and a rate per couple was negotiated for us. This rate allowed us to stay in the hotel or a villa. Four of the couples opted for the hotel while the remainder of us stayed in two 3- bedroom and one 5 bedroom Excel Villas. {This rate included transfers from La Romana Airport; use of golf carts for
reviews.title: Keep your expectations down....

reviews.text: each villa, (3 bedroom =2 golf carts, 5 bedroom =3 golf carts with each cart accomodating 4 people); maid and butler service daily in the villas and breakfast prepared as you preferred it with option of enjoying the breakfast buffet at the main resort area.)
reviews.title: For Those Who Are One With Golf, Not Nature

likes.liked: — The size and decor of the rooms
likes.disliked: — The distance from room to beach and the complete lack of respect for nature.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is AMAZING!!!! The service was unbelievable and outstanding!!! The rooms were very clean, turn-down service in the evening was superb!!! I've traveled a whole lot and this is my favorite destination, so far!!!!
reviews.title: High-End vacation

reviews.text: This has to be one of the best golf resorts ever! The three golf courses are absolutely amazing especially the Teeth of the Dog with its exquisite sea side golf holes! The staff are very helpful, courteous and warm. The food was great and the ability to go to various restaurants on the vast property was fabulous as you got to experience different menus. I would highly recommend and I hope that I can get back there soon!
reviews.title: Great Golf Resort!

reviews.text: I attended a meeting-conference and the setting was very good. Being somewhat remote, it was a good place since attendees could not wander off. Food, service was good.
reviews.title: Excellent Location for a Meeting

reviews.text: Was a great vacation at Casa De Campo. We started our vacation at Be Live Canoa ( Don't even bother.... a COMPLETE NIGHTMARE ) After 2 days of misery at Be Live Canoa , we moved to CDC.... They were VERY accommodating helping us move in and walked us through the impromptu reservation change to their facility. They were most helpful in everything. Played golf on all the courses while there and all were wonderful. All the restaurants superb. Nothing that we asked was ever a problem. Pick ups for dinner or travel to Chavon was speedy and courteous. Took Tropical Tours transfer when we left to Santa Domingo and $140 was a bargin. Helped us even get through check in at airport...Wow what service....We are booking to go back next year.
reviews.title: GREAT VACATION

reviews.text: We stayed ay Casa de Campo for a long wekend. Our friends were having a destination wedding.
reviews.title: Great vacation
Great vacation
reviews.text: This is my first time staying at the hotel. I have been to Casa de campo before but always had rented a house. The rooms are awesome, large rooms and large bathrooms. Great space and comfortable bed. Ac worked good and for me that is always key when you are in such hot weather.

Service is awesome, the restaurants run a bit slow, but this is a beach resort so it is to be expected. I was told by one of the managers that they have to take a certain amount of time even if the dish is ready ( 15 min minimum)
reviews.title: The Resort That Time Forgot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The golf is the best there is, I have played at ,any great courses (pinehurst, whistling straits) and this is up there with them. Ask for pepo the caddy if you get to play, great guy and very respectful.
reviews.title: Not a Good Start

reviews.text: Eat at pepperoni!
reviews.title: WOW

reviews.text: Overall this place is awesome, definitely one of my favorite places to go!
reviews.title: A breathtaking property that offers a lot

reviews.text: The hotel at this resort may be in need of some improvements, but they did a great job at making the beach and it's restaurant very attractive, and if you rent one of the luxury villas through a private brooker, you will have the vacation of a lifetime, espacially if you are an avid golfplayer.
reviews.title: greatest resort

likes.disliked: — very friendly but laid back personnel

reviews.title: Avoid this dump
reviews.text: Anyone who has ever stayed in a nice resort will avoid this dump.

reviews.title: casa de campo perfect summer trip
reviews.text: Service was awful. The whole place has been run down.

Worst of all they will rip you OFF. When you call to make reservations they will be helpful and speak English. When we disputed our bill_-extra charges,add on etc thay acted like they couldn't understand anything in English.
reviews.title: A day pass saved our vacation!

likes.liked: — the food, location, Altos de Chavon

reviews.text: Go there at your own RISK>
reviews.title: one week only
Great Week!!
reviews.text: Went to Casa de Campo for a family birthday trip. 19 of us in two luxury villas. Villas came with a maid and butler...both were terrific; great breakfasts each day. The bathrooms of our villas can stand to be updated. The A/C in the second villa was broken, but they did come and fix it promptly. Speaking of prompt, there was no such thing as "Island Time" here; we ordered buses each day to take us to dinner or golf and they were there exactly on time each and every time.
Golf was great. Loved walking the Teeth of the Dog course. Very playable and fun course. Dye Fore was much tougher (and very difficult to walk) but absolutely georgeous views on the back nine.
reviews.title: Golf at Casa de Campo

reviews.text: Food was pretty good for a resort like this. El Pescatore and the Tropicana were excellent. The Chinese and Italian joints were just so-so.
reviews.title: Private Villa Only Way To Go

likes.liked: — The house and service for the value was phenomenal

reviews.title: OH MY GOD -- 5 star, no way, $10.62 for 1 ltr of water!
reviews.text: Service overall was excellent; everyone was happy and helpful. Had a great time horseback riding. William and Margerite were great guides and I recommend asking for them.

Overall, we had a marvelous trip to Casa de Campo and I would highly recommend it for a large family trip or a boys golf trip. Get the full package deal which includes unlimited horseback riding, sailing, trap shooting. Also, the meal plan is a good idea and worth doing.
reviews.title: Casa de Campo (Dominican Republic). It sucks!

reviews.text: Dominican Republic is beautiful and the people are very nice. One of my favorite people in the world, Nina, lives in La Romana with her family and two children. We rented a house in the community and it was exactly what you would see in a movie. Super cool pools. Ocean views that are just amazing. The marina is a very cool area with a few good restaurants and some nice shopping. The marina area is very clean and classy. Rent golf carts to get around the community.
reviews.title: Super beautiful and very affordable.

reviews.text: My family and I found paradise on earth.
reviews.title: I found PARADISE

reviews.text: What a great place.
reviews.title: Beautiful place, friendly people, expensive, good but not great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was outstanding.
reviews.title: Just Do It!!!

reviews.text: The room are huge.
reviews.title: Wow-what a great place to go with the family!

aka: Casa De Campo Hotel La Romana
description: The symphony of the Caribbean has begun… unfolding over seven thousand acres of rolling hills, crashing waves and endless horizons. Nestled alongside the warm waters of the Caribbean Sea, Casa de Campo makes its home on the captivating southeast coast of the Dominican Republic. Lush by nature and newly redesigned to be more luxurious than ever, this paradise is the premier island retreat – perfect for action, adventure, relaxation, and sophisticated diversions for all ages. It is the story of an unsurpassed vacation experience that began 39 years ago and stands to this day as the living example of pure enjoyment.An on-property international airport and an all-new hotel, lobby, pool area and Elite-level rooms are just part of what awaits. There are also the myriad of experiences to be found at the Altos de Chavon artist and cultural village, a globally acclaimed Marina, an impressive array of world-class sports, chic shopping, the award-winning eco-immersion Cygalle Spa, bountiful dining in multiple restaurants and a collection of private villa home accommodations. Indeed, Casa de Campo reigns as the Caribbean’s Most Complete Resort. The grandest chapter in Caribbean vacationing is here… all that is missing is you.
